protocol.text: Stem fragments of 1.5 cm in length located 2.5 cm apically from the base were excised with a scalpel and transferred to MS split-plates considering the original apical to basal orientation. After 2 or 5 days incubation, the central area (3 mm) of these samples, which had no direct contact with the media, was collected for snap-frozen embeding in OCT.Transversal 5 µm sections were cut with a cryostat and mounted in slides that were used to capture the appropriate tissue utilizing Laser Capture Microdissection.
Plants were grown for 3 weeks on short days (8 hours light 16 hours dark) under standard conditions and then switched to lond days (16 hours light 8 hours dark)

Total RNA extraction was performed using the RNeasy Plus Micro Kit (QIAGEN) following the manufacturer´s instructions.Two RNA amplification rounds were performed using the TargetAmp™ 2-Round Aminoallyl-aRNA Amplification Kit (EPICENTRE Biotechnologies, Madison, WI, USA) following the manufacturer’s instructions.
Biotinylated aRNA were prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol (Expression Analysis Technical Manual, 2001, Affymetrix).
Following fragmentation, the aRNAs were hybridized for 16 hr at 45C on GeneChip ATH1 array. GeneChips were washed and stained in the Affymetrix Fluidics Station 400.
GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000.
The data were analyzed with the RMA method using limma and affy libraries in the Bioconductor statiscal package (R2.9.0).
